pRdsAUiqT0wVKhHm2wy53g.text: I love Carluccios, especially this one. I went here today for lunch and it was so nice. I got the Penne Giardiniera which was £7.25 and a total bargain for the quality of the food. It had courgettes, chilli, and deep fried spinach balls with parmesan and garlic. It wasn't a big portion but I wasn't that hungry so I didn't mind. The food was delicious though and with that particular dish they donate 50p to the Action against hunger charity which makes it taste all the sweeter. The building is beautiful too, upstairs is the private dining room and the ground floor has the lovely food shop and the cafe. My friend got a sandwich with mozzarella, pesto and tomato and although it seems really simple it came out on in a massive triangular ciabatta and I had a bite and it was gorgeous, and completely huge.The waiting staff were lovely, all very smiley and from what I could tell all Italian. Another friend told me that she didn't have a good experience there with the service but I don't believe her, Its always a great meal in Carluccios.

photos.caption: Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom

muTodgIJcqJazDP7n1UabQ.text: I do love a bit of Carluccio's, firstly because it reminds me of my parents, they love having coffee there back in Reading and secondly, well because the food is good, Italian and I love Italian.Because it is not the cheapest chain restaurant out there, I tend to only go for a special occaision or if my mum takes me. I always have the pasta and fried spinach balls- they are something special and a bit of the money goes to charity. The steak is not their best option, but the pasta is always good. Look at the specials. The sandwiches soups and foccacias are also amazing, the bread they serve you is delicious, but I say if you are already there, then just go all out on a meal. You might aswell. The coffee of course is amazing, as is the thick hot chocolote, nothing like the powder stuff. And for pudding you can't go wrong with the gelato, or the tiramisu... or anything really!This Carluccios is my favourite location wise, but there are lots of them dotted around the city- the chain seems to be doing well and is expanding rapidly. They also sell pasteries, cheeses, wines, ready made meals and anti pasti to go.

nsYVhnLP661ge5AwgJlWTg.text: Only giving this place one star because it is not possible to give it zero!! Have given this place the benefit of the doubt and returned a few times, will not bother again!! Yes they are busy, our server actually said they were 'always this busy', but they just cannot cope with the number of covers!! There are always several 'managers' wandering around doing nothing, the four tables where we were sitting were all badly served, we waited an age for starters (basically toasted bread with differing sides) and when they eventually arrived one was wrong!! (Not rocket science guys!!!), and our mains were brought by before the correct starter had managed to get to the table!! No proper apology for this, no drinks offered, we ended up eating out starters separately and then waited again for our mains as fresh ones had to be cooked!! The tables around us waited for drinks, food and coffees. I like Carluccios as a chain, but avoid this one at all costs, plenty of other places close by that offer good food and an acceptable level of service.

44dvFaOwtY1Pj3v0KEO_qA.text: Part of the chain of Italian restaurants that have popped over all over London now, the Covent Garden Carluccio's was refitted about a year ago and is still a lovely place to grab a bite to eat. Slightly on the pricey side, at least the menu is not off the shelf Italian and you can be assured of good quality food. The deserts and coffee especially are exceptional (but then, I have a sweet tooth!). The crowd is funky and vibrant and not-too-touristy, whih makes a change for Covent Garden. Definitely worth a visit if you want a quick meal - be sure to book during busy times as it gets full!

kga3_wE827hzn9CkWP6l_A.text: Very disappointed, good service but food was very salty including the bread.  Wine by the glass was also very mediocre (nero d'avola). Nice atmosphere but don't go for the food or wine....

-9rOFZIQROPTdidhFvZCgQ.text: Went there because they had gluten free pasta. It was undercooked and absolutely unedible. The service was horrendously poor, and management just talked about resolving the issue but did absolutely nothing about it. I would never go back there.

i_sn7mf8Hy1CbCK4l6Nw1g.text: This is one of the many Carluccio's in the London area. The difference is that I watched the entire place being fitted from my window at work. So I can tell you that the staff at Carluccio's are completely trained - they had a week's worth with maps of Italy and everything! The food at Carluccio's is delicious. Whether you sit down and eat or you choose something from their deli. Their prices are reasonable and you know you're getting good ingredients. This is a large Carluccio's with the bottom floor arranged in tables and booths on the side. Upstairs is pretty similar but with better and ofter lighting. I highly recommend a meal here. But a word of warning, book on a Friday at lunch time because it gets very full.

H_RgvjbklsW8fW1zjKc0Cg.text: Carluccio's is a great chain of Italian deli/pasta bars across London, serving a great range of pastas, salads, deli delights and coffees. This particular store is one of the best - with a warm, welcoming atmosphere and clean, classic decor. Great for coffee during the day, lunches or dinners, Carluccio's is consistent and reliable. Not groundbreaking, but hey, it doesn't always have to be does it?

SqyjBgsSFLDvW9JBGyldpg.text: I was at Carluccio's for a private wine tasting (brought to you by Qype!) so can't comment on the pricing, but the style and ambience of the restaurant was just perfect. Light, airy, with an amazing staircase (!) - it's somewhere I would take someone I needed to impress!

egAEvroR4LOjZIFTgGQmzw.text: Carluccios is one of the great successes of the chain world. An amazing feat when you consider how very average its food is. I blame those clever marketeers who have correctly surmised that if you display some authentic-looking deli bits and bobs at the front of the restaurants, chuck in some shelves of ludicrously over-priced but exquisitely packaged italian biscuits, spaghetti and the like, that diners will somehow fail to notice its less-than-exquisite dining experience.The other night at the Earlsfield branch my friend and I ordered a milanese risotto.As someone who has lived in Italy, I know that if nothing else there should be a smattering of saffron in this.Ma non. Instead we received white, cold slop in which a few gobbits of salsiccia bobbed mournfully. As for flavour..seasoning..garnish, there was none. It wouldn't have looked out of place on a school dinner menu (pre-Jamie Oliver style makeover). When I asked the waitress where the saffron was she looked blank and shrugged, saying: this is the chef's version. Rather like putting roast chicken on the menu and serving up a poached pear instead. Anyway, she was apologetic and - between bouts of listening to a neighbouring table's gripes about their meal - invited us to choose something else on the menu. This we duly did. When the bill came we found we'd been charged both for our second choices (and for one of the milanese risottos).Molto molto disappointing.

Phagj5ocNRXr7h0rCE-CGg.text: I recently attended a Planeta wine tasting in the private dining room at Carluccio's and I was very much impressed with the venue, the food and (especially) the wines and the uber-knowledgeable and enthusiastic sommelier/presenter for the evening. The Planeta wines (Sicilian whites, reds and a dessert wine) and the Planeta olive oil were delicious. I wanted to be critical of the wines - or, I should say, I expected to be - but I really couldn't find fault with them. Delicious wines and a good value (ranged from a tenner to less than 20) that I will certainly be buying in the future. The olive oil was fruity and fresh with no bitterness. A tad on the expensive size (£14 for a small bottle), but if your wallet permits, then it's a great choice. The venue was stylish, yet warm and inviting. The tasting was held in the private dining room, which is on the second floor of Carluccio's and overlooks the buzzy streets. It was a perfect setting and I'd love to have an excuse to organise something there again (or suggest it to someone who is looking for a private dining room). The antipasti (vegetarian and non) were delicious and super fresh (salame, porchetta, artichokes, olives, killer caponata, Sicilian-style cous cous and more). The small cannoli served with the dessert wine were very good and had fresh candied orange peel - something one doesn't usually find in cannoli outside of certain areas in Italy. Kudos (and a big thank you) to Mike for being so knowledgeable and infectiously enthusiastic about Planeta wines, whilst being relaxed and affable and making everyone feel right at home.

UzJAJ3U_ZPjGjehghHwnuw.text: Went along to a wine tasting at Carluccios flagship restaurant this week to taste its range of Planeta wines. It was fantastic. Not only did they serve us up some tasty treats from the kitchen (including home made cannoli,which was delicious as was the Planeta dessert wine) but the wine was also excellent. I especially liked the rose and the whites. If you are eating at Carluccios, don't miss one of the Planeta wines. If you're on your way to a dinner party - pop into a Carluccios cafe and buy a bottle of Planeta to bring along. You won't go wrong.

3_z8q8GfyBCbjXPe-g-nHg.text: miserable cold weather and I felt like having a pasta, not too bad but stuff rood and service so slow. will give it a try in another area

S7yb9n5BzQqqzqxeKiT3Iw.text: I am here every wednesday morning for a breakfast meeting, the venue fantastic and location superb. The breakfast is good although pricey, nevertheless worth a visit. The fact the scrambled eggs have spring onions, made it for me. Bacon tasty and mushrooms good.

qaGW3P-Zop7_NIImfSh8cg.text: I used to visit the Carluccio's deli when it was in Neal Street, and would buy their gorgeous big sandwiches, parma ham and cheese and salad between two big slices of delicious focaccia! But their range of olive oils, herbs, spices, sauces and pastas are amazing, and everything is good quality and full of flavour. Their Italian desserts and biscuits are hard to resist (honey cantucci anyone?) and make great gifts. You can even buy authentic limoncello here. They've sinced moved to Garrick street and had a whole new makeover.

JDaxsvm2YFtbarDgUY9q4w.text: The prix fixe evening menu is fantastic value for money in central London. Not much choice - but at £8.50 for two courses and coffee, what can you say? Buzzy lively atmosphere. Great to grab a quick, early evening bite before making the long journey home.

w0p3MSCn0j-6uBbH7YOTLQ.text: I had a lovely time at Carluccio's while I was in London. The prices were certainly high, but prices are high everywhere in London right now. The desserts were very nice, but the coffee (specifically my caffe latte) took the cake! (Pardon the pun.) It was everything an Italian coffee should be. I also ended up buying lots of little Italian treats to take home with me!

RVzz1jSw_V5q_w9hcIVdfA.text: Beautiful, delicious, fresh simple flavourful food. A lovely dining atmosphere as well! Unfortunately, our experience was marred because of the extremely rude and snobby service. The service staff should be ashamed of themselves for gossiping so obviously about the patrons. I would purchase food from the shop for take away without a doubt, but I would never dine there again. Unfortunately.

xx2-rNDU1hgtH4pnvTRfwA.text: I really like Carluccio's a lot. The customer service is excellent and the food is good. I had the ghnocci. My friend said her chicken salad was good too! The fresh apple juice is also tasty!

nlWtBk6GntIQDMkK-cgVPA.text: Beautiful grand interiors in this branch of Carluccios. The service was a bit slow, but my friends and I had only come in for coffees at the end of an evening, so we were happy to chat amongst ourselves while we waited for the bill to be brought over to us.

oApyWe-Ya-YRxYKXi39o0A.text: This is literally the reason I make it through my week full, happy, and without an empty wallet. Shortly after I discovered their lunch takeaway cafe office lunches for myself and all colleagues have been revolutionised. Delicious. Reasonable price. Healthy. Really good looking food. Can't wait to continue to eat here multiple times a week for the rest of the year.

0wbaZMsOQtGk56tdwbFupQ.text: This is definitely one of the nicest branches in this ever growing chain.However, a recent visit was marred by long waiting times and rather desinterested shop staff. A bit of a disappointment to be completely ignored when the maitre d' recommends the wine tastine next door. Oh well, their penne with courgettes and spinach balls is the perfect comfort food to get over this rather slack experience in no time at all.Perfect spot for a quick dinner before theatre.

lhkC8P-JN9jzZ4F-3R_vYg.text: This is probably the Carluccios with the most individual interior, compared to the usual design of the other Carluccios dotted around London. It is set in a beautiful building over two floors, with winding stair cases and high ceilings.  The food is consistently good in all the restaurants in the chain, but this is the place to go for the nicest atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom

el0LaUJ8PFfwhDjrHFjk9w.text: Underwhelming.  Starters were just bad (focaccia, garlic bread and pasta crisps).  Entrees ok - all had pasta, served al dente, fairly pleasant but not amazing.  Spinach balls were over-fried. Ordered pear and ricotta gelato but this was new and had apparently not arrived yet. Overall food was very average. Ambience was pleasant as was service.  Overall we would not rush back.

7EMlC8S0yyEpFxbDLoMDcA.text: The most TERRIBLE service and restaurant experience I have ever encounter because of the following things: 1. The waiter did not understand our order and therefore when I was eating my main meal my husband was eating nothing because he had eaten his main meal when I was eating my starter. 2. I had a small fly in my glass. 3. I had to wait about 30 mins for main meal after my starter. 4. By the time I had finished my main meal I was quite angry and could not have the (esspresso) drink as part of the set menu. They over charged me even though I clearly stated that I had wanted the set menu. 5. They forgot one part of the starter so the waiter had to give me the money back in coins. 6. No acknowledgement that the service I got was absolutely appalling. DON'T EVER GO HERE unless you want a terrible time!

QCTzfyF2n-tKTNI5ge8m5w.text: Great restaurant!  Showed up with a large group of 8 (didn't realize we needed reservations) and they still seated us promptly!  Also, I was excited to see they had a gluten free menu with a decent selection of items... A hard find when it comes to good Italian!   :)

JycyYMLO8jZ8GEE4G6th3Q.text: Thought food was very fresh and delicious.  We started with a mushroom bruschetta (special) and it was amazing.  We also had a charcuterie platter to start which was also very good.  2 of us had a basic spaghetti and meatballs and it was very good. You could tell the pasta was very fresh. 2 in our party had the chicken saltbocca.  It was a very large piece of chicken. I had a bite of it and it was very tender and juicy.  I would definitely go back there!

oJc_rvm8wbby4ttLyJUnow.text: Three years after the last review, its probably time for an update. Or a confirmation that standards at the Covent Garden Carluccio's have fallen since the heady days or 4- and 5-star reviews.We were going to the ballet and wanted a nice, simple dinner beforehand. We chose Carluccio's because we thought we could rely on a chain with a strong reputation; we'd both enjoyed good food in other branches and were looking forward to the meal.We went for the Fixed Price menu as it included items from the main menu that we would have chosen anyway. But it seems the bargain price of the Fixed Menu (£12-£13 for three courses) doesn't buy you quality. The bruschetta starter  who would have thought an Italian restaurant could make a bad bruschetta!  was cold and the super tough piece of toast didn't even have a full topping. Only half the slice was covered with tomato mix, the rest with cheap salad leaves!We both chose ravioli for the mains. The (apprx) six pieces of stodgy, tasteless pasta had the meanest filling (not truffle or venison, but spinach and ricotta, so I'm not sure why the stinginess). This was served with the most watery, flavourless sauce ever. Sure, it was a butter sauce, which is usually a subtle flavour, but you should never have to drown a sauce with parmesan and pepper just to make it palatable. Even after that, I couldn't bring myself to eat it.In all fairness the staff were very responsive, which is why the review has two stars: When the waitress came to check if we were enjoying our meal, I bluntly told her the pasta was horrible. I was going to leave it at that; we didn't want to bother complaining as we didn't want to spoil the rest of the evening. But the waitress obviously passed on the comment to her manager, who came over to us. He was very friendly and pleasant, and I stressed we didn't want to make a complaint and I wasn't looking to try another dish. (By that point I wasn't confident anything else would be better, and we really didn't have the time.) The manager offered to take the price of the meal off our bill.However, I can confirm that the ice-cream and tiramisu were fine.So, nice staff, nice atmosphere, potential for great value if the food makes the grade, but a waste of time and money if it doesn't.I sat through a three hour ballet with my tummy rumbling, unpleasantly distracted with the thought of what I could have for supper when I got home  :-(

LxPAuJnwNRRZbJJDoZlnfQ.text: Love this place. Good food. Could be a bit cheaper for what they server.Check it out ... Its kewl

24isEbuAbyiLVgD1TbkGGw.text: I always find Carluccio a bit hit and miss. Having been there many times here are my observations. For those who are Gluten free the pasta dishes are fantastic. They're fresh and taste a whole load better than Gluten free pasta from the supermarket. The normal pasta dishes are pretty good, nothing special though. I think Carluccio wins on its risotto dishes, always delicious. They lose on their steak (always overcooked), and some of their fish dishes. The desserts are always delicious. So there you go, mixed bag!

I3GJTRGT1tFMiscMOhALIA.text: I love the building of this Carluccio's because it's got a wonderful staircase that I like to imagine people in ballgowns descending from. I've been to this particular restaurant mid-week and on a Friday night and the only complaint I've got is how long we had to wait for a table on the Friday night. We didn't have a reservation, but it's Carluccio's!... There are lots of them dotted around London, so you think it wouldn't be that hard to get a table... we were wrong.That said, we were invited to sit in the store, where they sell bread sticks and meringues and flavoured olive oils, which they laid out like a feast and we were allowed to partake in. We literally tried everything there was there, so long was our wait, but my god, was the food amazing and we hadn't even gotten a table yet. It's also a good ploy to get you to buy their food whilst waiting! We were so full, we wondered whether it was worth eating food there, but eventually we got a table and ascended up the pretty staircase into the dining rooms upstairs. I recommend you have the Lemon Granita, it's my favourite drink there. It's the sort of drink you would have an a hot summer's day in Italy and I can't get enough of them!I also had the pasta con funghi that night and that was just bliss. The pasta was freshly made, the mushroom perfect cooked and the portion generous. Our server was really cool, very humorous and totally deserved the big tip we donated later. I love the dining rooms and the space and the way they are laid out and this is just a really good place if you want great food, great service and a wonderful setting. Definitely one of my top places to eat in Covent Garden!

xUTyI3fKgA3SpYmMFub0xA.text: This Carluccio's is very centrally located and has an added wow factor with a great circular stone staircase and a light and airy private function room with big windows. I was there for the Sicilian wine tasting evening, when qypers got to taste the entire range of Planeta wines, accompanied by some fab antipasti and cannoli to die for. These are easy-drinking wines. If you like oaky chardonnay, you'll like any of the whites (La Segreta Bianco £8.95; Alastro £12.50, Cometa £19.50, Chardonnay). I have to declare I prefer a nice grassy sauvignon blanc from Chile/ NZ, and you just can't grow white wines like that in Sicily, so they weren't really my cup of tea (!). The reds, however, were far more up my street: big, robust flavours. The 'entry level' La Segreta Rosso was one of my faves. I also liked the top-end Santa Cecilia (£19.50), the Syrah and the Burdese (=in the bordeaux style). The Cerusuolo di Vittorio (£19.50) is v quirky and tastes of cherries (Cerusuolo=cherryish). Not for me, but others loved it, so clearly a personal choice. There was also a strong Merlot (14% vol) which fell somewhere in the middle of my preferences, but very quaffable. And unusually for Sicily, a Rose for £10.50. Last, but certainly not least, was the lovely dessert wine Passito di Noto, a moscato bianco, which went perfectly with the divine cannoli. All the wines are available from the Carluccio's shop on the ground floor (open until 11pm). As is a very good olive oil, also produced by Planeta for £14.95.

4eZUaUs_-3_SnUa5JnSfMQ.text: AbFab dahling! It was an evening of wine, information and friends. So much fun I want to go back for more. In fact, I AM going back for more - going to Carluccio's to buy some of that most stunning olive oil. That Planeta stoned olive oil is worth every penny of it's price! The wines were all stunning with the 'gorse bush' and Saint Cecelia wines both tickling my palette in just the right way. The upstairs private dining room is beautiful but even more stunning is the downatairs space. The shop is well stocked and fun with the eatery intimate but spacious. I highly recommend a trip down here as quick as you can!

PYtK4l5FuU0jYRzXzf7Eyw.text: After arriving fashionably late due to London's great transport system I joined my fellow Qypers for a delightful evening at a private wine tasting at Carluccio's. The Planeta wines, white, red and dessert were delightful and our host Michael was very knowledgeable and dare I say very passionate about these wines. The antipasto dishes were quite individual and a wonderful mixture of delicious meats, cheeses, veggies and breads that are available to buy in the deli downstairs. To accompany the dessert wine plates of moreish cannoli appeared. Many thanks to Carluccio's for a delightful evening and I look forward to returning there for a meal in the near future.

P518L2Ws8Qld9rC2DhVdJw.text: I've gotta hand it to Carluccio's. Their flagship Covent Garden location is an elegant space, especially the upstairs dining room! If you ever get a chance to wine-n-dine here (as I and about 20 other Qypers did at a Sicilian wine tasting event (london.blog.qype.com/?p=…) ), by all means take advantage of the opportunity. It's a lovely spot, smack dab in the heart of Central London but above and removed from the fray. I think Carluccio's do Italian right. They offer a brilliant selection of wines (I love Planeta's Alastro) and solid antipasti. In fact, everything I've tried on their menu has been fine by me, especially the calf's liver. Drool.

cdJCTrs-gVrDwSnJgkqz5g.text: Sometimes when you walk into a place, you think to yourself: tonight is gonna be good. That's exactly what tonight was! A blend of delicious meats, cheeses, veggies and breads to graze on while I sampled the Planeta wine that Carluccio's stocks. If the weather had been sunnier and the view a bit more rustic (rather than an overcast central London), I'd have sworn I'd been transported to Sicily with a group of friends. Interesting discussions were had and playful teasing happened over breads dipped in Planeta's olive oil - so buttery, with a hint of pepper. The finishing touch was a cannoli filled with a cream with bits of chocolate and candied orange peel whipped into it, and served along with a glass of Moscato. YUM! You can leave the gun, but most definitely take the cannoli!

qqOO90ZgHphdWII-c03ZyQ.text: This is the second time I've been to Carluccio's & both times have been full of great food, easy atmosphere & a nice drop of wine to go with it all. I was lucky enough to be invited to the Planeta (Sicilian)wine tasting in the private room upstairs of their Garrick St restaurant in Covent Gardeneverything from rose', light whites, oaked whites, deep reds & a lovely crisp desert wine to finish off the evening. The antipasto platter that was served with these wines was sooo tasty & fresh but the cannoli - what can i say.YUM! There were 20 of us at the tasting & by the looks of it we all learned a bit about Planeta wines and even their olive oil (thanks to Michael). Thanks to Carluccio's, Planeta & Qype for a lovely night out.

56ocra4GrsZBnY3bmiHoAw.text: Located in Covent Garden, my BFF and I stopped in one night for the chicken liver pate and calamari appetizer to start.   The chicken liver pate was really good and I wanted to get another one but had already ordered the pasta, so had to refrain from doing so.  We ordered the ravioli spinach e ricotta and the tagliolini napolenta.  The pastas were done really well and quite filling.  Definitely coming back for the chicken liver pate. I can eat that and be very happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom. Tagliolini Napolenta
Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom. Stuffed shells with spinach and ricotta
Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom. Chicken liver pate

O1L-Dpwi9yiLNZlNMtwZyg.text: Ok. So a bit intoxicated and in need of a meal we picked this place because they had heat, outdoor seating and pasta sounded good at the time. No issues with service at all. The pasta just wasn't good. Tasted like the sauce came from a can. We ate it out of necessity but I wouldn't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom

ioSMyOhYC5nJsbBEZZpFvw.text: Okay. we came here for lunch today with my family becuse it's near Covent Garden.  We sat down after 5 minute.  Olive oil was amazing.  but the service is slow. Waited 30 minutes our dish to come out.  The salad dressing was  very refreshing.  The chicken risotto was somewhat blend.  My thought the truffle flavor was missing.  The sausage pasta was good.

6mD5VrJl8IzP10VXE1Bjpg.text: We were walking towards Covent Garden and were lured in by a waiter offering samples of pizza. The prix fixe menu seems like a good deal. Restaurant also had free wi-fi

photos.caption: Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom

Nosv9aDRpa62A7GI1uVdoQ.text: This place was beyond exceptional! Lovely atmosphere, friendly staff, and delicious, reasonably priced food. I came here alone and had a very well-made Aperol spritz and the penne giardiniera. Both were great, and I had a lovely time reading my book and enjoying my meal. Will definitely be coming back soon!

xKCAQXZOktthHM1CsUAQmQ.text: Terrible food. Terrible service. Overpriced. The worst example of London chain restaurants. Ripping off tourists and Londoners alike.

E6knuWSXzw8ZM1rQy7Pntg.text: My wife really enjoyed her penne guardiniera and I found my beef ragu delightful. Especially, the crispy parma ham in my meal was full of flavors - jerky-chewy and perfectly accompanied the soft beef sauce. Oh, and their crispy calamari appetizer comes with a surprisingly good mayonnaise with just enough tangy touch of lemon. So good!Since my wife loved it so much, maybe I'd be back in the future. Our server Mandor with awesome italian accent was so nice and sweet. He maden our experience here more memorable.Come check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom. Mandor the man! Our server was awesome.

WwlSguuee7vjOz55DIsVuQ.text: Was looking forward to the restaurant as heard the original chef was highly regarded by Jamie Oliver. Unfortunately he passed away and it appears his restaurant will soon too.... after being sat at our table it took over 15mins for a waiter to see us...not crowded by the way...however the servers chatting it up and cleaning tables...once ordered food the starters were out in less than 5mins however over 40mins and waiting for the main which btw is a lunch menu special....I do not recommend as the food and service is very blah....Wish I was seeing the sites in London and not waiting for food!

eUUlh4PpfkClqjYm3clOgQ.text: Great food, service and atmosphere. Was with a group 6, we ordered a seafood linguine, spaghetti carbonara, duck pappardelle and lamb alla griglia to share. The food was amazing my favourite was the duck pappardelle! Would definitely recommend trying the fresh lemonade!! Good place to go for a special occasion or even just for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Carluccio's - London, United Kingdom

975z5m4Jo1HagaDvHHUQJw.text: By far the worst food in London . The bread is inedible taste like salt brink, The pizza actually had a hole in the middle in a bowl. The soup was from a can.

P3S6qmLZcnxyeJJuX92bvQ.text: Since, I had had such a decent experience at the Carluccio's in Pinner. when my husband wanted to eat Italian, I had no hesitation in recommending the Carluccio's that was next door in Covent Garden.The place was buzzing They occupy 3 floors, with washrooms in the basement, the store and one seating space on the ground floor and 2 seating spaces on the first floor. The place was full and we thought that was an indication of how good it was. Sadly, the crowds belied the quality.The calamari fritti that I had loved at the Pinner location, was soggy and soaked in oil. The antipasto had only meat on the platter unlike what was suggested on the menu. We had to ask for some bread to be served with the cold meats. Our request for olive oil, never materialised.We ordered the trio of pastas, including the heavily recommended ravioli. There was absolutely no hint of the sage in the dish and it felt like the ravioli had just been tossed in melted butter rather than butter browned with sage. When we brought this to the servers attention, he promised to get us a fresh plate properly made or to give us complimentary coffee, but we turned it down, since we knew we would not be able to finish the other two pastas that were quite good. The tortelloni with braised venison and the papardelle with mushroom, both of which had much more flavour to them and were much better tasting.The servers were doing their best, but they were just too badly over worked. Too many tables and not enough staff. Plus the food had to be brought up to the first floor from the ground floor, turning it slightly cold in the meanwhile.This was my first bad experience at Carluccios. I have since had horrible non service at Hampstead & less than average food at St Pancras.I loved Carluccios in Dubai. But never again in London

BNvnETrkqZzIRZy1_Xfo8Q.text: Great meal here last night. Service was excellent and the food was good with great value for central London. I love their range of dishes, with meat-less options which weren't treated any differently from other dishes- I'm not a vegetarian but don't like eating meat too often, and hate it when there's one token vegetarian option,  instead of a great menu with vegetables involved. Anyway- I probably be back. .. maybe to try that two course deal during the week :)

Y6U-b19fIze6Q27cZE_OJg.text: Depending on what you order, the food is very good. The calamari was fresh and the Branzino is amazing. Service was ok.

NROOG2S1KmWKfYBa14Ih8g.text: Shared the Tasting Trio for Two. Tried the Pasta con Funghi, Gnocci al Goronzola, & Penne Giardiniera. All were delicious! Great places for dinner & wine with coworkers or friends.

XnWiBwcBYBDoCRX712m4dQ.text: Popped in for breakfast I was starving . chose the eggs Benedict which was delicious  .Best I've had in a long time and set me up for my flight ahead . Loved the atmosphere and the staff were efficient and friendly prices were reasonable and the OJ was fresh and cold

3kYEivn5Zyzy8X_3b_qKHQ.text: If you want authentic fresh Italian food this should be your first choice! Breakfast is served all day! or if your feeling indecisive you can try the trio of pasta's.They also have a great deli where they sell all of their products as well as doing a hot counter at lunch if you've got to dash.I love love love Carluccio's!

QHso09Ak9QcrDtiezWKpIQ.text: My wife and myself chose Carluccio's in Covent Garden for lunch recently on a visit to London. This wasn't our first visit to this restaurant, but was by far our best meal here. The menu is standard, although my wife chose the Lobster Lasagne from the specials board and said how delicious this was. The wine choice is good and the service was efficient without us feeling like we were being rushed out of the place. The only criticism I have of this venue is how crammed in you are, particularly on tables for two, and it's easy to feel like you're eating with strangers, which is sometimes really great fun, but only when you choose to. Having said this, it's perfectly understandable why they want/need to service so many covers, particularly over lunch time. The lemon tart with an accompanying glass of ice cold Limoncello is an absolute treat, and I would recommend this desert option to all non-drivers (or people who don't have to go back to work) out there.

b0SBafXAjPwDlhM16jAl8w.text: Not good Italian, salads didn't look fresh, everyone's pasta was overlooked. Very little mozzarella in the "mozzarella salad", not fresh looking rocket and cherry tomatoes. Pros: staff is good and reimbursed us for the soggy bruschetta. Antipasti platter was impressive. Cons: low quality food and too much clatter noise from staff tossing utensils and plates behind the bar.

Q3aoGuqoZ8lXwetN-PROwQ.text: at the end of a long day of touristy activity we ended up in this area in Covent Garden.. We were specifically looking to stop at Tesco to pick up a couple things.Tesco was shuttered for a remod, so we decided to check into Carluccio's for dinner.While I know it's a local chain it was quite good.The wait staff was knowledgeable and charming, the food was quite good, the portions were reasonable without being elephantine (see Olive Garden - US).The wine recommendations were very nice and a good meal was had by all.We enjoyed dinner enough that we decided to try them for breakfast as well.Their take on eggs benedict was a hit with everyone.Again, our waitress was knowledgeable and charming, helpful without hovering.We were very pleased with both of our visits to Carluccio's and I expect we will visit them again next time we're in London.

G-zydxOwdu-uNxewR-eTWQ.text: A friend who grew up in London suggested this to me today as a great place to get what we Americans like to call "brunch" that odd meal that is a combination of breakfast and lunch.  Carluccio's has a number of locations in London- but this is their flagship location.Located in Covent Garden just about a block from the Tube Station at Leicester Square, Carluccio's is located in an old building and uses all three stories with a beautiful worn stone staircase curving up and around to the upper dining area.  The place was packed (obviously everyone had the same idea) so it took awhile to get seated. Also- know that this is not a quiet restaurant so know before you go if you are looking for a quiet dining experience you won't find it here.Once seated- I had to wait about 25 minutes before I was able to flag someone down to see about placing my order.  While apologetic- I watched table after table try to get our server's attention to no avail.I wanted to order Eggs Benedict but they had run out of hollandaise sauce (odd since it is made with eggs and lemon juice and some spices which a restaurant surely must have) but I went along with it and ordered scrambled eggs with mushrooms, tomatoes and ham instead.The food came up promptly although the toast that was described on the menu was actually under the food rather than served on the side.  It was all very salty which was also surprising given the movement toward lowered sodium in the UK.I decided to redeem my visit (and get the salt taste out of my mouth) with a dish of strawberry gelato which was absolutely delicious (what can be wrong with gelato of any flavor, I ask you?)All in all . .a bit pricey for what you get and I wish the service had been better.  But as for that gelato?  I'd go back in a second!
